content.description: Here you can add icons or/and text to your button.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

label.description:
Explain what happens when this button is clicked.

"This takes you to the about page."

"This takes you to Stripe, an external payment processor where you can purchase my service."

target.description:
This decides whether the clicked button opens a new tab or keeps the user in the same tab.

_blank = new tab is opened with the url of this button
_self = current tab's content is replaced

button_size.description: This option determines how large the button is.

button_theme.description: This determines the styling of the button (colors).

button_width.description: This controls whether the button expands into all available space in the container it is in, or whether it simply becomes the size of the text/icons/paddings that it contains.

components.name: container
components.description: Container is essentially a powerful div with lots of layout functionality.

container_id.description:
The id by which this container can be referenced to in code.
If one word, simply input the name in lower caps.
If multiple words follow the kebab-format like so:
section-id-like-this

container_class.description: Same as id, this can be used for DOM manipulation or other means.

content_direction.description:
This dictates the direction of your content. 
Row = Left to Right, Single column on mobile.
Only Row = Left to Right
Column = Top to Bottom

justify_content.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

align_items.description:
This defines how your content aligns across the secondary axis. If you have 2 items inside this container, and your content direction is a "row", this can choose whether both are aligned to the top, bottom, stretching across the entire container, etc. 
Experiment and see how it works.

wrap_content.description: This allows the direct-child elements to wrap themselves around the column/row.

gap.description: This is the gap between the elements (bloks) within this section. So the amount of space between 'items' you add.

flex.description:
This is a flex-child property. You can set the 
Flex Grow + Flex Shrink + Flex Basis with this single property.
Default     =  1 1 0%
Flex Auto  = 1 1 auto
Flex Initial = 0 1 auto
Flex None = none

align_self.description: Override for the flex parent's align-items value. We can align the flex-child-item on the cross-axis.

margin_top.description: This pushes other content away on top of this container.

margin_bottom.description: This pushes other content away on the bottom of this container.

max_width.description:
Choose the maximum width of this container. 
0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

height.description: Simple way to manipulate the height of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

all_padding.description: Padding is the space within the container that pushes the content inwards. If you have a background for example, you will see space within the container that surrounds your content.

vertical_padding.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

horizontal_padding.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

min_height.description: You may require a minimum height of an element. Make sure to also select the 'minHeightUnit' option.

min_height_unit.description: This allows us to have more control over the minHeight, by being able to select units like 'vh', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

min_width.description: You may require a minimum width of an element. Make sure to also select the 'minWidthUnit' option.

min_width_unit.description: This allows us to have more control over the minWidth, by being able to select units like 'vw', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

overflow.description:
Select what happens when content overflows this section. In most cases the default option will be preferable.
Default: Visible

customStyling.description: You can add custom CSS styling here. Ensure it's written as in-line css and every css property/value you add comes with an " !important " value as well.

border_radius.description: Border radius controls how sharp or curved the edges of the link are.

logo.description: Please create the logo for your website. You will have a single element as a choice, click on it and fill it in.

nav_links.description:
These are the links your users will see on the top of your website.

This does NOT include the logo or Call to Action button in the top-navigation, just the centre links.

button.description: This is an optional button you can add to act as a CTA in your top/header navigation. It goes on the right of the navigation.

custom_css.description: Optional custom css you can add to the <div> containing the svg icon.

components.name: nav_link
components.description: This link should only be used in the Header component, not Footer.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

link_label.description:
This is what the website user reads. 

So this should be "Home" | "About" | "Services" | "Work with Me" | "Contact" etc (without the quotation marks).

icon.description: Select this option and then an icon if you want an icon to accompany your link.

link_description.description: Add a description to the link to explain what it does and where it will take you.

sub_links.description: If you want a 'menu' of links, lets say you have multiple services and you want users to hover over services and see options, this is the link you should use.

sub_link_type.description:
If this is not a sub_link (embedded link), ignore.
Else, if it is a sub_link, you have the option to style the link slightly differently.

If you have 3 services, you can have 3 sub links for them. But you also might want to have a "All Services" link that's clickable. In that case this would be a "mobileMainLink". In mobile the sub_link menus are opened by clicking on buttons, not links. This is just a workaround that's very explicit.

components.name: nav_logo
components.description: Use this logo only for the Header component.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

logo_image.description: In some cases you will want your logo to just be an image (PNG, SVG, etc). Simply upload an image and select it here.

gap.description: Choose the amount of space between the logo image and the text (if both are present). Else this property won't do anything.

components.name: page
components.description: All page content, excluding header and footer.

blocks.description: Insert the website content into this blok .This excludes the Header and Footer elements. Do not expose any private data into this component as everything you input will be exposed to the public, so only public content goes in here.

mainAriaLabel.description:
Describe what this page's content is all about.
For example, if this is the 'About Page', you can say:
"Main content that explains who <First_Name/Company_Name> is all about."

pagePosition.description: This controls the position property for CSS. It's advisable to just leave this setting alone and let your developer handle it if needed.

section_id.description:
The id by which this section can be referenced to in code.
If one word, simply input the name in lower caps.
If multiple words follow the kebab-format like so:
section-id-like-this

section_label.description: A short sentence-long description of what this section is about. If the section is the 'benefits' section it could be: "A list of benefits my service offers you."

type.description:
Choose whether this is a section or an article. This does not mean a 'newsletter article' or anything like that, it's a semantic HTML element that symbolises this 'section' is a standalone piece of content, as in ~ it makes sense by itself, with no other content around it. 

Most of the time this should be left as the default 'section' option.

grid_span.description: Full Span = Full Width. Centred Spans = Limited Widths

justify_content.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

align_items.description: Control how your items are positioned along a container's cross axis.

gap.description: This is the gap between the elements (bloks) within this section. So the amount of space between 'items' you add.

vertical_padding.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

horizontal_padding.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

overflow.description:
Select what happens when content overflows this section. In most cases the default option will be preferable.
Default: Visible

customStyling.description: You can add custom CSS styling here. Ensure it's written as in-line css and every css property/value you add comes with an " !important " value as well.

components.name: simple_text
components.description: Text with no styling attached to it. Simple string.
